author: jlokier
content: If you're comfortable reading a lot of code and prefer a code description, I would actually suggest reading one or two of the EVM implementations in your preferred languages. Most parts are fairly clear, if long: They are bytecode interpreters and most opcodes are fairly simple, almost explain themselves. Some obscure corner cases aren't so obvious but there's usually a reference to the appropriate EIP. If you want to understand the EVM as a bytecode stack machine, I suggest don't get drawn into the details of the storage database or Merkle tree implementation, because those are almost separate to the EVM itself, and their implementations are complicated for performance reasons.  On the other hand, if you like database performance optimisation, they are the more interesting part ðŸ™‚
